title: Freedmen's Bureau Records: Mrs. James Harden to Mr. Thompson, August 4, 1867
summary: Mrs. James Harden writes to Thompson about a woman, Horner Tines, she employed as a cook. According to Harden, the other servants believe Tines is a conjurer and will not work with her, but Tines refused to leave after she was dismissed.
keywords: Employment/Labor, Women, Community Values/Local Behavior, American Civil War
